import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)


import os

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.e5733c5e:
cols = ['Deaths - Air pollution - Sex: Both - Age: Age-standardized (Rate)',
       'Deaths - Household air pollution from solid fuels - Sex: Both - Age: Age-standardized (Rate)',
       'Deaths - Ambient particulate matter pollution - Sex: Both - Age: Age-standardized (Rate)',
       'Deaths - Ambient ozone pollution - Sex: Both - Age: Age-standardized (Rate)']
source.bfac8d9d:

fig.show()
source.515cb828:
fig = px.line(death_rates.loc['India'], x="Year", y=cols, markers=True, title="Death Rates from Air Pollution in India")
fig.show()

risk_col =['Unsafe water source', 'Unsafe sanitation','No access to handwashing facility',
       'Household air pollution from solid fuels','Non-exclusive breastfeeding', 'Discontinued breastfeeding',
       'Child wasting', 'Child stunting', 'Low birth weight for gestation','Secondhand smoke', 'Alcohol use', 'Drug use', 'Diet low in fruits',
       'Diet low in vegetables', 'Unsafe sex', 'Low physical activity','High fasting plasma glucose', 'High total cholesterol',
       'High body-mass index', 'High systolic blood pressure', 'Smoking','Iron deficiency', 'Vitamin A deficiency', 'Low bone mineral density',
       'Air pollution', 'Outdoor air pollution', 'Diet high in sodium','Diet low in whole grains', 'Diet low in nuts and seeds']
source.c0a3ba44:
fig = px.line(risk_factors.loc['India'], x="Year", y=risk_col, markers=True, title="Number of Deaths by Risk Factors in India")
fig.show()
source.c83d42b0:
fig = px.line(risk_factors.loc['World'], x="Year", y=risk_col, markers=True, title="Number of Deaths by Risk Factors in World")
fig.show()
source.fec4a503:
Here we have pollution data of 4 sub categories
* Deaths by risk factors
* Death rates due to pollution
* Deaths share by pollution
* Death rate total air pollution
